title: I think Xerath has the worst autoattack in League of Legends
body:
- Turtle projectile speed
- About as damaging as those tree helicopter seed things
- Janky ass animation that ends up cancelling half your shots if you dare to kite
- Janky ass animation is also so long, it takes like a full second to autoattack after casting a spell.  Good luck farming under tower, or while shoving the lane.  You know what, good luck farming
- Projectile looks as lame and weak as it is, zero impact.  Isn't Xerath a god or something???  I can make flashier electricity humping my carpet

It's like being Annie without the easyfarm Q.

Xerath rocks, and he's not weak or anything, and hardly anyone plays him (haven't seen one besides me in probably 100 games), but can myself and the two other Xerath mains of the world just get this one as a favor?  Laning as Xerath sucksss because autoattack farming is such a chore, and he can't rely on his spells to farm until 2+ items.  Please Rito, a quality of life buff to Xerath's autoattack.

It

restores

Mana?
That's why they made the Q a global non-missable skill, just took people this long to figure out how to use it. (sarcasm)
Xerath is not really meant to AA besides for his passive. Farm with Q and W, poke with Q and W, and combo with QWE and R for all other occasions as needed.

You'll run oom like that unless every passive procs on a champion.

Unless you're talking about like 10 minutes in.
His passive procs on anything I think.
It gives two or three times (can't remember) as much mana when it procs on a champion.  It also has a cooldown.

Then just learn to last hit like everyone else. 14 or so seconds is a meh CD for free mana on an ability spammer. Farm minions, build {{item:3165}} first, and poke efficiently. Don't just spam your combo every single time it comes off of CD. Look for good angles to poke and farm if possible too. Practice is basically all you need to last hit with any champion. So can you guess what you should do? 

Go into practice mode and practice last hitting on Xerath

* Disable tower fire and make them invincible
* Have no enemy or ally champions
* No items, masteries, or runes
* lock yourself at level 1* (do not give yourself any "special" circumstances like infinite health and mana with no cooldowns. That would invalidate this training completely)
* Just last hit with autos and Q

Then once you get the hang of it, (to where you basically get about 70-100% of the minions in about 5 minutes)

* Add runes, masteries, other abilities 
* Disable level lock too (but start at level 1 still)
* Do not build unusual (don't give yourself massive amounts of gold, full 6 items, AD, etc... that Xerath would normally never have or at least never have at that point in a real game)

Then after you manage the same

* Add in tower fire and practice under tower farming (let minion wave push and such)

Once you get the hang of that

* Add in an opponent (not someone stupid like a Garen, but an actually common mid lane opponent)

I farm fine with autos as Xerath.  I was simply saying that your saying we could farm with just spells and auto just for the mana was false.

Also don't forget that Xerath's Q has a pretty high mana cost to make him more dependent on his passive mana gain.

Right... Well I can see where the confusion happened. What I meant is that you should mainly use abilities and make sure you auto something every time your passive comes off of CD. He can still AA if needed or desired, but your main damage is from your abilities, which make last hitting far easier.

Specifically, you should look for good angles to both poke the enemy and farm a few minions with if possible so you do not waste as much mana.
